intro: Psyllocarpus scatignae, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The tree produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
